Name: official/nexus
Description: The Nexus Repository is like the local warehouse where all of the parts and finished goods used in your software supply chain are stored and distributed.

Configuration.Name: repository_component_uploads
Configuration.Description: A structure that describes file uploads to nexus repositories according the component rest api. Only files mounted in the volume 'repository_component_uploads' can be used. Missing repositories should be created with the claim scripts.

Configuration.Name: current_repository_component_ids
Configuration.Description: Holds current component ids uploaded by `repository_component_uploads`. Only edit these values while debugging repository_component_uploads.

Configuration.Name: claim/once
Configuration.Description: A claim script definition which is only executed once. After that, it will save the timestamp of last execution internally to prevent further executions. See 'claim/once.timestamp'.

Configuration.Name: claim/once.timestamp
Configuration.Description: If set to a current timestamp, it will execute the claim/once script. The timestamp has to be in the format `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss` (e.g. `2025-03-20 09:30:00`). Before execution this timestamp is compared with the timestamp from the last execution of the 'claim/once'-script. If the timestamp entered here is “newer”, the script will be executed.

Configuration.Name: claim/always
Configuration.Description: A claim script definition which will always be executed at startup.

Configuration.Name: nexus.repository.sandbox.enable
Configuration.Description: Enable repository sandboxing

Configuration.Name: installDefaultDockerRegistry
Configuration.Description: If set to false, the default docker registry is not installed

Configuration.Name: disableOutreachManagement
Configuration.Description: Disable the outreach management capability

Configuration.Name: logging/root
Configuration.Description: Set the root log level to one of ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG. The default log level is set to "WARN"

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's memory usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). We recommend to add 50m for additional tools running inside the container.

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_max_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Nexus process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory when the container has more than approx. 250 MB of memory available. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Nexus: 25%

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_min_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Nexus process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory when the container has less than approx. 250 MB of memory available. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Nexus: 50%

Configuration.Name: cleanup_policy/notes
Configuration.Description: Notes to the default cleanup-policy. Default: "Do not edit. CES will re-generate this default policy during each Nexus start-up that will overwrite your changes. You may want to create your own policies which will stay untouched during the start-up."
Configuration.Default: Do not edit. CES will re-generate this default policy during each Nexus start-up that will overwrite your changes. You may want to create your own policies which will stay untouched during the start-up.

Configuration.Name: cleanup_policy/policy_format
Configuration.Description: Repository format on which the default cleanup-policy can be applied. The default is "maven2" which corresponds to maven repositories

Configuration.Name: cleanup_policy/criteria/regex
Configuration.Description: Regex which will be used to match fitting artifacts. Default: ".*SNAPSHOT"

Configuration.Name: cleanup_policy/criteria/release_type
Configuration.Description: The release type on which this policy will be applied. This configuration can only be applied if the 'policy_format' is of type "maven2", "yum" and "npm". Default: "PRERELEASES"

Configuration.Name: cleanup_policy/criteria/days_till_recognition_for_delete
Configuration.Description: The number of days after which an artifact is recognised for deletion. Default: "14"

Configuration.Name: compact_blobstore_task/enabled
Configuration.Description: Switch to control whether the policy should be switched on or off. Default: "true"

Configuration.Name: compact_blobstore_task/blobstore
Configuration.Description: The specific blobstore instance to that the task should be applied. This configuration should only be used if the task type is 'blobstore.compact' (or other tasks that need to choose a blobstore instance). Default: "default"

Configuration.Name: compact_blobstore_task/cron
Configuration.Description: Cron string (in Quartz syntax) that sets the task's schedule. The default "0 0 3 * * ?" value will run the task daily at 3:00 AM.

Configuration.Name: carp-limiter/token-rate
Configuration.Description: The token-rate of the carp-limiter in which tokens are added to the bucket in tokens/second. Default is 50

Configuration.Name: carp-limiter/burst-size
Configuration.Description: The size of the bucket for the carp-limiter. It sets the amount of tokens the bucket can hold. Defaults to 150

Configuration.Name: carp-limiter/clean-interval
Configuration.Description: The clean interval in seconds for the carp-limiter, in which old limits from the limiter are cleaned. Defaults to 300 seconds (5 minutes)

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal memory requirement. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/swap_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's swap memory usage. Use zero or a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). 0 will disable swapping.

Configuration.Name: container_config/cpu_core_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's CPU core usage. Use a positive floating value describing a fraction of 1 CPU core. When you define a value of '0.5', you are requesting half as much CPU time compared to if you asked for '1.0' CPU.

Configuration.Name: container_config/cpu_core_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal CPU core requirement. Use a positive floating value describing a fraction of 1 CPU core. When you define a value of '0.5', you are requesting half as much CPU time compared to if you asked for '1.0' CPU.

Configuration.Name: container_config/storage_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's ephemeral storage usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/storage_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal ephemeral storage requirement. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: proxyConfiguration/http/host
Configuration.Description: The host name of the HTTP proxy server. This has to be set for HTTPS and non proxy hosts, too.

Configuration.Name: proxyConfiguration/http/port
Configuration.Description: The port of the HTTP proxy server. This has to be set for HTTPS and non proxy hosts, too.

Configuration.Name: proxyConfiguration/http/authentication/username
Configuration.Description: The authentication username of the HTTP proxy server. Use either username and password or a NTLM hostname and domain (if using a Windows NT LAN Manager).

Configuration.Name: proxyConfiguration/http/authentication/password
Configuration.Description: The authentication password of the HTTP proxy server. Use either username and password or a NTLM hostname and domain (if using a Windows NT LAN Manager).

Configuration.Name: proxyConfiguration/http/authentication/ntlmHost
Configuration.Description: The authentication ntlmHost of the HTTP proxy server. Use either username and password or a NTLM hostname and domain (if using a Windows NT LAN Manager).

Configuration.Name: proxyConfiguration/http/authentication/domain
Configuration.Description: The authentication domain of the HTTP proxy server. Use either username and password or a NTLM hostname and domain (if using a Windows NT LAN Manager).

Configuration.Name: proxyConfiguration/https/host
Configuration.Description: The host name of the HTTPS proxy server.

Configuration.Name: proxyConfiguration/https/port
Configuration.Description: The port of the HTTPS proxy server.

Configuration.Name: proxyConfiguration/https/authentication/username
Configuration.Description: The authentication username of the HTTPS proxy server. Use either username and password or a NTLM hostname and domain (if using a Windows NT LAN Manager).

Configuration.Name: proxyConfiguration/https/authentication/password
Configuration.Description: The authentication password of the HTTPS proxy server. Use either username and password or a NTLM hostname and domain (if using a Windows NT LAN Manager).

Configuration.Name: proxyConfiguration/https/authentication/ntlmHost
Configuration.Description: The authentication ntlmHost of the HTTPS proxy server. Use either username and password or a NTLM hostname and domain (if using a Windows NT LAN Manager).

Configuration.Name: proxyConfiguration/https/authentication/domain
Configuration.Description: The authentication domain of the HTTPS proxy server. Use either username and password or a NTLM hostname and domain (if using a Windows NT LAN Manager).

Configuration.Name: proxyConfiguration/nonProxyHosts
Configuration.Description: A list of hosts that should be reached directly, bypassing the proxy. This is a list of patterns separated by |.

Configuration.Name: database/maxConnections
Configuration.Description: maxConnections configures how many connections to the postgresql database nexus occupies. Postgresql has 100 connections by default, the amount can be configured with key `config/postgresql/database_config/max_connections`
